interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Honey, I Shrunk the Kids
Review Date: 2020/04/29
Store: Rick Moranis  (Actor),     Thomas Brown  (Actor),     Hiro Narita  (Director),     Joe Johnston  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
Product Description: ['Get set for the adventure of a lifetime in the No.1 comedy hit of the year, Honey, I shrunk the kids! Rick Moranis stars as a preoccupied inventor who just can\'t seem to get his electro-magnetic shrinking machine to work. Then, when he accidentally shrinks his kids down to one-quarter-inch tall and tosses them out in the trash, the real adventure begins! Now the kids face incredible dangers as they try to make their way home through the jungle of their own backyard! Hurricane sprinklers! Dive-bombing bees! A runaway lawn mower and much, much more! Directed by Academy Award(R)-winner Joe Johnston (Visual Effects, Raiders of the lost ark, 1981), this record-breaking smash is full of amazing special effects, hilarious comedy, wild chases, and nonstop surprises! Early on one of the characters realizes, "We\'re now a quarter of an inch tall and 64 feet from the house. That\'s an equivalent of 3.2 miles". The movie was directed by Joe Johnston, who won a 1981 Academy Awards for Visual effects for raiders of the lost ark.']
Average Rating: 4.7

Lost in the Barrens
Nicholas Shields  (Actor),     Evan Adams  (Actor),     Michael J.F. Scott  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['"Your strength and your courage will be shown in the good works that you do for others." When the trust fund keeping orphaned Jamie in his upper-class boarding school runs out, he must cross the continent to live with his Uncle Angus, a fur trapper, in the Canadian wilderness. Disobeying his father, Awasis, a native boy, and Jamie explore the breathtaking territory on their own. A careless accident makes the unlikely pair realize that their disobedience could cost them their lives. A loyal friendship is sparked as they begin to their vast cultural differences in a different light. But will that light burn brightly enough to lead them safely home?']

Scotty Leavenworth  (Actor),     Amanda Michalka  (Actor),     Tim Nelson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: Unknown Binding
Movies & TV, Movies
['(2009) Marvin Mobley dreams of becoming a great baseball player but no matter how much he practices or how hard he tries, he doesn’t improve. His dream finally comes true when he finds a mysterious pair of glasses that turns him into the greatest baseball player his town has ever seen. After the glasses disappear, Marvin doesn’t believe he can play but with the support of his team he learns that winning doesn’t mean anything if you can’t be proud of how you play the game.']

Legend of the Viking Cross Dvd! Feature Film for Families
Format: Unknown Binding
Movies & TV, Movies
['"If your brother needs you, you can\'t refuse him," Angeline tells Awasis, urging him to help their friend, Jamie, who has embarked on a dangerous journey. However, Jamie is guiding a treasure hunter named Connolly to a place Awasis never wants to see again -- the Viking grave. Connolly is nothing but a grave robber as far as Awasis is concerned. That\'s why he didn\'t hire on as one of Connolly\'s guides. Unfortunately, the lure of fame and fortune proves irresistible to Jamie. He is soon caught up in the hunt for a jewel-laden cross made of white gold, supposedly buried in the ancient Viking crypt. Jamie realizes too late that the cost of his perilous adventure may be far too high. If Jamie is to survive, Awasis must overcome his hurt feelings and team up with Angeline to rescue their "brother."']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD'}

good family movie
Still Mine
James Cromwell  (Actor),     Genevieve Bujold  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['In his first lead role after decades of playing supporting characters, James Cromwell gives a tour de force performance in STILL MINE, an exquisitely crafted and deeply affecting love story about a couple in their twilight years. Based on true events and laced with wry humor, STILL MINE tells the heartfelt tale of Craig Morrison (Academy Award(R) nominee Cromwell), who comes up against the system when he sets out to build a more suitable house for his ailing wife Irene (Academy Award(R) nominee Genevieve Bujold). Although Morrison uses the same methods his father, an accomplished shipbuilder, taught him, times have changed. He quickly gets blindsided by local building codes and bureaucratic officials. As Irene becomes increasingly ill - and amidst a series of stop-work orders - Craig races to finish the house. Hauled into court and facing jail, Craig takes a final stance against all odds in a truly inspirational story.']

['Unraveling a series of clues left behind by his grandfather, Mickey Matson and his friends embark on a magical journey in search of a mythical ancient device. With the future of the country hanging in the balance, they will have to outsmart and outrun an evil conspiracy that dates back to the civil war. Chock full of exciting twists and turns, the Adventures of Mickey Matson and the Copperhead Treasure is a fun adventure for the whole family!']

The Cat's Meow Cat Sitter DVD (Animal Planet)
Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Movies
['Animal Planet has created the perfect cat sitting solution. Your cat will be captivated by the fish swimming in a larger than life aquarium, birds in motion, rabbits, squirrels and lizards scurrying across the screen...']
{'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD'}
My cat loves this dvd. She sits through almost all of it. It is nice to see the large birds and chickens and rabbits etc. great sounds as well. The only thing I did not like is the inappropriate people part. They did not have to add the people or long length of cats playing. Otherwise I would have rated it a 5 if they left out the people and put a short time of other cats playing.
It is nice to see the large birds and chickens and rabbits ...

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genres of Interest:** The user continues to express a strong preference for drama and family-oriented narratives that emphasize emotional connections and personal growth. They also enjoy action-adventure stories that inspire curiosity and exploration, reflecting a broad appreciation for diverse storytelling.

- **Content Format:** They favor a combination of classic and modern cinema formats, such as VHS and DVD, showcasing their love for nostalgic viewing alongside contemporary experiences.

- **Gift-Giving:** The user remains committed to selecting family-friendly films that entertain audiences of all ages, reinforcing their focus on promoting shared experiences and quality time with family.

- **Review Behavior:** Their reviews reflect a positive disposition toward family-centric content, and they maintain high expectations for quality. The user has shown a discerning taste and emphasizes the importance of clean, appropriate entertainment, especially for children.

- **Personal Values:** Emphasizing narratives filled with connection, compassion, and the journey of life, the user prioritizes thoughtful storytelling. In their latest interaction, they acknowledged that certain elements may be concerning for younger viewers, while still appreciating engaging content, indicating their commitment to quality and appropriateness in entertainment.

Overall, the user continually seeks enjoyable films for both themselves and their family, alongside an emphasis on quality and suitability for all viewers.
